title: How to Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes. You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries. If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil.

steps.headline: Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes.
steps.description: Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes. When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though.

steps.headline: Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes.
steps.description: When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned. Stir the mixture once or twice while it's cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don't burn.

steps.headline: Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes.
steps.description: After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes. Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly. You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste.

steps.headline: Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender.
steps.description: When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through. Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn't enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons.

steps.headline: Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods.
steps.description: When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods. The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage.

steps.headline: Boil the sweet potatoes until tender.
steps.description: Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender. Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes.

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes and dry completely.
steps.description: When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment.

steps.headline: Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic.
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden. You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer.

steps.headline: Season the mixture.
steps.description: Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment.

steps.headline: Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they're tender.
steps.description: Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender. Stir the potatoes occasionally while they're heating to ensure that they cook evenly.

steps.headline: Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they're crisp.
steps.description: Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp. Don't stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside.

steps.headline: Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture.
steps.description: When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended. If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash.

steps.headline: Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein.
steps.description: After you've finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish.

methods.name: Whipping Up Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description:
To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it's important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour.
steps.description: For the breakfast baked potatoes, you'll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour. You'll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance.

steps.headline: Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool.
steps.description: When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes. The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut.

steps.headline: Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings.
steps.description: When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them. You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness. You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts. Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options.

steps.headline: Mix the potato and toppings together and eat.
steps.description: To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.

text:
Preparing Sweet Potato Home Fries Heat the oil. Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes. You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries. If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil. Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes. Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes. When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though. Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes. When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned. Stir the mixture once or twice while it's cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don't burn. Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes. After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes. Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly. You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste. Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender. When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through. Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn't enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons. Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods. When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods. The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage. Creating Sweet Potato Hash Boil the sweet potatoes until tender. Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender. Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes. Drain the potatoes and dry completely. When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment. Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic. Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden. You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer. Season the mixture. Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment. Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they're tender. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender. Stir the potatoes occasionally while they're heating to ensure that they cook evenly. Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they're crisp. Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp. Don't stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside. Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture. When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended. If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash. Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein. After you've finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish. Whipping Up Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes Preheat the oven. To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it's important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour. For the breakfast baked potatoes, you'll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour. You'll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance. Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool. When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes. The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut. Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings. When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them. You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness. You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts. Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options. Mix the potato and toppings together and eat. To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.
sentences: Preparing Sweet Potato Home Fries Heat the oil.
Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet.
Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes.
You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries.
If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil.
Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes.
Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet.
Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes.
When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated.
Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though.
Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes.
When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion.
Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned.
Stir the mixture once or twice while it's cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don't burn.
Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes.
After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt.
Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes.
Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly.
You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste.
Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender.
When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet.
Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through.
Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet.
If it isn't enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons.
Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods.
When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat.
Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods.
The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage.
Creating Sweet Potato Hash Boil the sweet potatoes until tender.
Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat.
Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender.
Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes.
Drain the potatoes and dry completely.
When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly.
Set them aside for the moment.
Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic.
Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes.

Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden.
You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer.
Season the mixture.
Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment.
Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they're tender.
Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet.
Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender.
Stir the potatoes occasionally while they're heating to ensure that they cook evenly.
Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they're crisp.
Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high.
Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp.
Don't stir the potatoes as they cook.
That will help them crisp up on the outside.
Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture.
When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture.
Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended.
If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash.
Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein.
After you've finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat.
Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish.
Whipping Up Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes Preheat the oven.
To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it's important to preheat it.
Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a4\/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour.
For the breakfast baked potatoes, you'll need 2 large sweet potatoes.
Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet.
Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour.
You'll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance.
Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool.
When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife.
Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes.
The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut.
Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings.
When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two.
Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them.
You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness.
You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts.
Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences.
Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options.
Mix the potato and toppings together and eat.
To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings.
Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.
